Using Trace Data to Find Root Cause of an Error
Cut Monitoring Costs with Dynamic Logging

agents/java/configuration.title: Installation
agents/java/configuration.description: Follow the below steps to install Sidekick SDK to your application.

agents/java/README.title: ‚òï Java
agents/java/README.description: This topic describes how to prepare the application environment and install the Sidekick Java Agent

agents/java/source-bundling.title: Source Bundling
agents/java/source-bundling.description: For detecting mismatches between source code on your local and actual code running on remote applications, Sidekick agent requires source codes to be available in the running application artifact (jar). So source codes should be put into artifacts while building. Otherwise, source code incompatibility checks will not be applied as this is optional. In case of code level conflict is detected between local and remote, put tracepoint request will be rejected.\

agents/node.js/data-redaction.title: Data Redaction
agents/node.js/data-redaction.description: Sidekick Node agent lets you define custom data redaction functions. Below you can see the related confing and an example:

agents/node.js/error-stack-collection.title: Error Stack Collection
agents/node.js/error-stack-collection.description: With our Node agent‚Äôs latest update, developers can now activate automatic error stack collection and start collecting exception call stacks from their running applications without stopping them.

agents/node.js/installation.title: Installation
agents/node.js/installation.description: First install the node agent by running

agents/node.js/installation-1.title: Docker Configuration
agents/node.js/installation-1.description: In this section we will explain how you can use Sidekick Node.js agent with a containerized application.

agents/node.js/README.title: üü¢ Node.js
agents/node.js/README.description: Sidekick agent Nodejs is a Node.js library that communicate with Sidekick broker to inspect, monitor and debug your application on the fly.

agents/node.js/troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
agents/node.js/troubleshooting.description: You can use the parameters below to troubleshoot your agent.

agents/python/data-redaction.title: Data Redaction
agents/python/data-redaction.description: Sidekick Python agent lets you define custom data redaction functions. Below you can see an example:

agents/python/error-stack-collection.title: Error Stack Collection
agents/python/error-stack-collection.description: You can now activate automatic error stack collection and start collecting exception call stacks from your running applications without needing for putting a tracepoint beforehand.

agents/python/installation.title: Installation
agents/python/installation.description: Follow the below steps to install Sidekick Agent Python to your application.

agents/python/installation-1.title: Docker Configuration
agents/python/installation-1.description: After installation you can bundle Sidekick agent with your containers to debug them while they are running. Below you can see how you can run your container with related Sidekick configurations.

agents/python/README.title: üêç Python
agents/python/README.description: Sidekick is a live application debugger that helps you to diagnose flaws & bugs in Python applications with near zero overhead thanks to the asynchronous approach.

agents/README.title: Sidekick Agents
agents/README.description: Sidekick provides agents for Java, Python, and NodeJS runtimes. You can find them below:

installation/get-api-key-and-token.title: üóù Get API Key & Token
installation/get-api-key-and-token.description: You don't need to get an API Key & token for your self-hosted instances. You will be setting your token and key as environment variables. https://github.com/runsidekick/sidekick/tree/master#configure-environment-variables

installation/signup-with-thundra-sidekic.title: üñã Sign up for Sidekick
installation/signup-with-thundra-sidekic.description: In order to get started with Sidekick, you need to create an account. You can sign up for Sidekick within a minute after clicking this link.

integrations/grafana-plugin-for-remote-c.title: Grafana Plugin for remote controlling Sidekick Actions
integrations/grafana-plugin-for-remote-c.description: This panel plugin lets you to control all your Sidekick tracepoints & logpoints and tags within Grafana.

integrations/integrations/coralogix-inte.title: Coralogix Integration
integrations/integrations/coralogix-inte.description: Sidekick Coralogix integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Coralogix instances.

integrations/integrations/elasticsearch-.title: Elasticsearch Integration
integrations/integrations/elasticsearch-.description: Sidekick Elasticsearch integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Elasticsearch instances.

integrations/integrations/logz.io-integr.title: Logz.io Integration
integrations/integrations/logz.io-integr.description: Sidekick Logz.io integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Logz.io instances.

integrations/integrations/loki-integrati.title: Loki Integration
integrations/integrations/loki-integrati.description: Sidekick Loki integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Loki instances.

integrations/integrations/new-relic-inte.title: New Relic Integration
integrations/integrations/new-relic-inte.description: Sidekick New Relic integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your New Relic instances.

integrations/integrations/slack-integrat.title: Slack Integration
integrations/integrations/slack-integrat.description: Sidekick Slack integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Slack channels.

integrations/integrations/solarwinds-log.title: SolarWinds Loggly Integration
integrations/integrations/solarwinds-log.description: Sidekick Loggly integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Loggly instances.

integrations/integrations/sumo-logic-int.title: Sumo Logic Integration
integrations/integrations/sumo-logic-int.description: Sidekick Sumo Logic integration allows you to send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to your Sumo Logic instances.

integrations/integrations/webhook-integr.title: Webhook Integration
integrations/integrations/webhook-integr.description: Sidekick allows you to set custom webhook targets and send your Tracepoint events, logs & error snapshots to them.

integrations/node.js-client.title: Node.js Client
integrations/node.js-client.description: Control your Sidekick actions using code!

integrations/open-telemetry-tracing-inte.title: üîå Open-Telemetry Tracing Integration
integrations/open-telemetry-tracing-inte.description: If you have Open-Telemetry agent installed, then the Sidekick Node.js agent will automatically recognize it and enable its tracing support.

integrations/thundra-apm-tracing-integra.title: üîå Thundra APM Tracing Integration
integrations/thundra-apm-tracing-integra.description: You can enable distributed tracing by integrating Thundra APM agent as explained here. Note that, to be able to use Thundra APM agent, you need to have a separate Thundra APM account which you can get it here.

intro.title: üè´ Index
intro.description: Sidekick is an open-source Live Application Debugger that helps you to debug issues where they happen, when they happen, without stopping, rebuilding, or redeploying applications. Sidekick agents give you powerful dynamic observability features with near-zero overhead.

master.title: ‚ùì Why Sidekick?
master.description: Sidekick helps you quickly and easily modify the collected data to understand the application's behavior in real-time better. This is particularly useful in a live production environment, where it is often necessary to understand and troubleshoot issues quickly and efficiently.

open-source/agent-settings.title: üïµ Agent Settings
open-source/agent-settings.description: In order to use Sidekick agents with your self-hosted Sidekick instances you need to override their brokerHost and brokerPort values.

open-source/quick-start.title: ‚ö° Quick Start
open-source/quick-start.description: We have prepared a quick start application for you.\

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/common-erro.title: Common Errors
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/common-erro.description: This tutorial applies to both IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm & WebStorm

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/getting-sta.title: Set up IntelliJ Plugin
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/getting-sta.description: You can download our plugin and participate in our public beta through JetBrains Marketplace.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/login.title: Login and Connecting Broker
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/login.description: This tutorial applies to both IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm & WebStorm

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/README.title: IntelliJ IDEA Plugin (Java)
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/README.description: Sidekick IDEA Plugin enables developers to debug their Java applications remotely from the comfort of their IDE. With this plugin, developers can build faster by resolving the issues in production & pre-production better.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/self-hosted.title: Self-hosted Settings
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/self-hosted.description: This tutorial applies to both IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm & WebStorm

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoint-.title: Browsing Tracepoint Events
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoint-.description: This tutorial applies to both IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm & WebStorm

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoint-.title: Tracepoint Event Detail
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoint-.description: When you double-click an event on the events table, you can see the snapshot details right next to the tracepoint list

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Conditional Tracepoints
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: You may need to take snapshots only when certain conditions are met. Use the ‚ÄúCondition‚Äù box in the edit popup to specify an optional condition:

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Distributed Tracing Integration
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: Sidekick integrates all tracepoints automatically with the rich distributed tracing so that you can see the tracepoint events with all the other actions that your application does end-to-end.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Edit Tracepoint
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: It is possible to edit a tracepoint by right-clicking on the tracepoint icon, similar to any arbitrary breakpoint. From this window, it‚Äôs possible to enable or disable the tracepoint, enable or disable distributed tracing (disabled by default), to define the condition for taking snapshots, and to change the default expiration settings of the tracepoint.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Enable/Disable Tracepoint
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: When a tracepoint is disabled, it will not be removed but it will stop capturing snapshots. A disabled tracepoint can be enabled back again later till it gets expired. So, disabling a tracepoint is useful when you need to remove it temporarily.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Expiration Settings
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: Any tracepoint will expire after certain hit count or time (age) limits are exceeded. When a tracepoint expires, it will be removed automatically. There won't be any tracepoint events for this tracepoint.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Tracepoints
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: This tutorial applies to both IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm & WebStorm

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Remove Tracepoint
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: There are multiple ways to remove a tracepoint.

plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.title: Set Tracepoint
plugins/intellij-idea-plugin/tracepoints.description: Setting up a tracepoint helps developers understand code execution on specific parts of an application. It‚Äôs as easy as setting up an ordinary line breakpoint with just one click on the gutter area.

plugins/pycharm-plugin-python.title: PyCharm Plugin (Python)
plugins/pycharm-plugin-python.description: Sidekick PyCharm Plugin enables developers to debug their Python applications remotely from the comfort of their IDE. With this plugin, developers can build faster by resolving the issues in production & pre-production better.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/import-s.title: Connect Source Code
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/import-s.description: It's essential for Sidekick agents to know which branch/code you want to debug. By connecting your source code, you allow Sidekick to understand the correct source code and the correct tracepoint location. Currently, you can import your source code from your GitHub and Gitlab repositories.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/README.title: How to
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/README.description: These pages describe the core concepts on how to start using Sidekick for debugging your application. In order to start and get the best out of Sidekick, you need to perform essential actions. In this section, we'll provide the below guides about those actions:

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/remote-c.title: üéá Remote Config
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/remote-c.description: Remote Config allows us to easily attach and detach Sidekick agents from running applications as well as change agent settings remotely using the Sidekick WebIDE. This can be particularly useful for users with multiple apps with Sidekick agents installed, as it allows us to manage the agents from a central location.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/set-trac.title: Put Tracepoints & Logpoints
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/set-trac.description: In order to gather valuable insights from your application, you can start setting tracepoints for your applications. Before setting a tracepoint, make sure that:

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/take-sna.title: Take Snapshots (a.k.a Tracepoint Events)
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/take-sna.description: After you connect your source code, select applications to debug, and put tracepoints, Sidekick will automatically start taking snapshots, in other words; generating tracepoint events, when the remote application is executed.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/use-trac.title: Enable TraceMap for Debugging
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/how-to/use-trac.description: Sidekick integrates all tracepoints automatically with the rich distributed tracing so that you can see the tracepoint events with all the other actions that your application does end-to-end.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/co.title: Code Panel
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/co.description: After you connect your code, you can open any file that you'd like to view or debug to the code panel. Sidekick lets you put tracepoints for the application code.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/ev.title: Events Panel
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/ev.description: After you put a tracepoint and execute the code, Sidekick will take a snapshot of the application. You will be able to see the list and the details of snapshot events taken by the Sidekick on the Events panel.

plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/RE.title: Introduction to Web Application
plugins/sidekick-web-ide/introduction/RE.description: This guide explains the components of Sidekick's Web Application.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Browsing Tracepoint Events
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: After your application triggered on line that is put tracepoint, you can see incoming events by clicking tracepoint or opening Sidekick Panel.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Common Problems
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: * Safari login issues: We are working on this issue. Until then you can try changing your default browser to Mozilla Firefox or Google Chrome.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Login & On-boarding
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: This guide explains how to log in to your Sidekick account on Visual Studio Code.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Visual Studio Code Extension (Python & Node.js)
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: Sidekick VSCode extension enables developers to debug applications remotely from the comfort of their IDE. With this plugin, developers can build faster by resolving the issues in pre-production & production using real data.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Select Workspace & Application
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: Sidekick allows you to have more than one workspace so that you can seperate your apps for different contexts or environments.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Self-hosted Settings
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: You need to change your broker host and port at the Sidekick settings.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Set up VSCode extension
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: You can download our extension and participate in our public beta through VSCode Marketplace.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Conditional tracepoints
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: You may need to take snapshots only when certain conditions are met. Use the ‚ÄúCondition‚Äù box in the edit popup to specify an optional condition:

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Edit Tracepoint
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: You can edit your tracepoints by clicking on the Pen icon next to each tracepoint under the Tracepoints panel.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Enable/Disable Tracepoint
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: When a tracepoint is disabled, it will not be removed but it will stop capturing snapshots. A disabled tracepoint can be enabled back again later till it gets expired. So, disabling a tracepoint is useful when you need to remove it temporarily.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Expiration Settings
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: Any tracepoint will expire after certain hit count or time (age) limits are exceeded. When a tracepoint expires, it will be removed automatically. There won't be any tracepoint events for this tracepoint.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Tracepoints & Logpoints
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: When you put a tracepoint on a line, the Sidekick agent on the corresponding remote application takes a snapshot of the local variables on that point when the execution passes from that point and sends them as tracepoint snapshot events back to your VSCode instance.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Remove Tracepoint
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: You can delete your tracepoints by clicking on the Bin icon next to each tracepoint under the Tracepoints panel.

plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.title: Set Tracepoint
plugins/visual-studio-code-extension-pyt.description: Setting up a tracepoint helps developers understand code execution on specific parts of an application. It‚Äôs as easy as setting up an ordinary line breakpoint with just one right-click on the desired line and selecting the Add Tracepoint button under the Sidekick section.

plugins/webstorm-plugin-node.js.title: WebStorm Plugin (Node.js)
plugins/webstorm-plugin-node.js.description: Sidekick WebStorm Plugin enables developers to debug their Node.js applications remotely from the comfort of their IDE. With this plugin, developers can build faster by resolving the issues in production & pre-production better.

quick-start-to-thundra-sidekick/README.title: üèÉ Get Started With Sidekick
quick-start-to-thundra-sidekick/README.description: If you like to know how Sidekick works, take the following guided tour which you can learn how to start debugging your apps in just 5 mins:

reference/conditional-tracepoints.title: Conditional Expressions
reference/conditional-tracepoints.description: You may need to take snapshots only when certain conditions are met. Use the ‚ÄúCondition‚Äù box in the edit popup to specify an optional condition:

reference/logpoint-expressions.title: Logpoint Expressions
reference/logpoint-expressions.description: Sidekick Logpoint expressions are based on \{{ mustache \}}. You can get detailed information about the mustache library from here//mustache.github.io/mustache.5.html

sidekick-actions/error-stack-collection.title: üö® Error Stack Collection
sidekick-actions/error-stack-collection.description: Automatic error stack collection is a feature of Sidekick that allows you to automatically collect the stack trace of an error as it occurs without requiring manual intervention. This can be a valuable tool for debugging and troubleshooting issues in an application, as it provides a detailed record of the application's execution at the time of the error, which can help you understand what caused the error and how to fix it.

sidekick-actions/logpoint.title: ü™µ Logpoint
sidekick-actions/logpoint.description: Logpoints bring the power of dynamic logging to Sidekick users. Replacing traditional logging with dynamic logging has potential to lower stage sizes, costs and time for log searching while giving ability to add new logpoints without editing the source code, redeploying or restarting the application.

sidekick-actions/reference-events-and-pr.title: üíæ Reference Events & Probe Tags
sidekick-actions/reference-events-and-pr.description: Sidekick allows you to save reference stack events,  compare stacks, and control multiple logpoints and tracepoints using tags.

sidekick-actions/tracepoint.title: üîé Tracepoint
sidekick-actions/tracepoint.description: Non-breaking breakpoints that bring the ease of local debugging to production!

use-cases/conditional-stack-and-log-coll.title: Conditional Stack & Log Collection
use-cases/conditional-stack-and-log-coll.description: Conditional stack and log collection is a debugging technique that allows you to selectively collect stack traces and log messages based on specified conditions. This can be useful in various situations, such as when you are trying to troubleshoot an issue in a live production environment or when you want to optimize the performance of your application.

use-cases/cut-monitoring-costs-with-dyna.title: Cut Monitoring Costs with Dynamic Logging
use-cases/cut-monitoring-costs-with-dyna.description: Dynamic logging with logpoints is a debugging technique that allows you to modify an application's log output while running without requiring a restart. This can be useful for debugging and troubleshooting issues in a live production environment. It allows developers to quickly and easily add or modify log statements in the application to collect more detailed information about its behavior.

use-cases/developer-on-boarding.title: Developer on-boarding
use-cases/developer-on-boarding.description: Logpoints and tracepoints are features of live application debuggers that can be particularly useful for onboarding new developers.

use-cases/dynamic-logging.title: Dynamic Logging
use-cases/dynamic-logging.description: Dynamic logging refers to modifying an application's log output while running without requiring a restart. This can be useful for debugging and troubleshooting issues in a live production environment. It allows developers to quickly and easily add or modify log statements in the application to collect more detailed information about its behavior.

use-cases/error-stack-collection-and-sta.title: Error stack collection & stack-based backend tests in E2E tests
use-cases/error-stack-collection-and-sta.description: E2E tests ensure that the application performs as expected by running the test cases based on user workflows. Tools such as Cypress, Playwright & Selenium enable us to define and apply those tests easily.

use-cases/identifying-stack-changes-and-.title: Identifying Stack Changes & Stack Comparison
use-cases/identifying-stack-changes-and-.description: Identifying stack changes and stack comparison is a debugging technique that involves comparing the stack traces of two different executions of an application to understand how the application's behavior has changed. This can be useful in various situations, such as when you are trying to troubleshoot an issue in a live production environment or trying to understand how changes to the application's code have affected its behavior.

use-cases/pinpointing-causes-of-errors.title: Pinpointing Causes of Errors
use-cases/pinpointing-causes-of-errors.description: Pinpointing the cause of errors is a common task when debugging an application, and tracepoints can be helpful for this purpose.

use-cases/production-debugging.title: Production Debugging
use-cases/production-debugging.description: Production debugging refers to identifying and fixing issues that occur in a production environment, which is the environment where a software application or system is deployed and used by real users. Production debugging can be challenging, as it involves diagnosing and fixing problems that may not have been identified during the development or testing phases of the software.

use-cases/README.title: ü•û Use Cases
use-cases/README.description: Sidekick comes with many different features. It is not limited to the ones we offer.

use-cases/remote-debugging-kubernetes-cl.title: Remote Debugging Kubernetes Cluster, Pods, and Containers
use-cases/remote-debugging-kubernetes-cl.description: In the context of live application debugging, remote debugging refers to the practice of debugging an application that runs on a remote machine rather than on the local machine where the debugger is running. This can be particularly useful when the application runs in a Kubernetes cluster, as it allows developers to troubleshoot and fix issues without setting up a local development environment or manually deploying the application to their local machine.

use-cases/using-trace-data-to-find-root-.title: Using Trace Data to Find Root Cause of an Error
use-cases/using-trace-data-to-find-root-.description: Trace data refer to the detailed information that is collected about the execution of an application. This data can help debug and troubleshoot issues in an application, as it provides a detailed record of what the application was doing at different points in time.
